title: Grand Theft Auto IV

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-34-generic, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes:
Downloaded Xliveless and installed it into the game directory.
Added tv.rockstargames.com to the file /etc/hosts. 
Minor graphical glitches in the sky and occasional flickering shadows. If framerates are low, lower visibility range. 1440p works fine for me, but some may have to go with 1080p for a smoother experience.
Nvidia users may have to do some extra steps: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/350
title: Grand Theft Auto IV

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 570 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.27.0, 4.19.0-1-MANJARO, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes:
Single Player only; Requires bypassing GFWL and blocking rockstar server (it freezes the game during launch), ignore/cancel the last 2 setup stages for GFWL, then extract the XLiveLess DLLs into your game folder, and add "127.0.0.1 tv.rockstargames.com" to your etc/hosts (no quotes).

Performance is iffy (settings performance impact seems exponential), as an aid add "GALLIUM_HUD=simple,fps %command%" (no quotes) to your steam Launch options, it's easier to adjust the game settings to achieve a sweet spot. for me it was a stable 40+ @1440p with high/mid-distance settings.
title: Grand Theft Auto IV

notes: Black screen with XLiveless (won't start at all otherwise)
title: Grand Theft Auto IV

notes:
- Using 3 tweaks from https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/350#issuecomment-420212825

- Disabled Esync with PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 in runtime args

- Game runs solid 80-90 fps in cinematics (beautifully), but as soon as it is the actual, playable, freecam game, FPS drops to about 20-30 on low/medium settings

- Everything works, just seems to really be lacking on performance
